titleStmt.title: Letter, Carter, J. V. in Knoxville, Tenn. to Customs House Officers, Cincinnati, Ohio.1863 October 7

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, G. V. Carter in Knoxville, Tenn., to Customs House Officers, Cincinnati, Ohio, 1863 October 7
bibl.note: In this letter dated 7 of October, 1863, G. V. Carter writes to the Customs House Officers, Cincinatti, Ohio that O.P. Temple be permitted to ship family supplies and merchandise to Knoxville, Tenn. Burnside signature approved.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Office Pro. M. G. of E. Tenn
It is recommended that O.P. Temple Esqr. a loyal citizen - be permitted to ship family supplies & merchandise to Knoxville, Tenn.
B. G. & P. M. G of
